title: Softbank-backed hotels chain OYO has a $10bn valuation, but could it end up being the next WeWork?
text:
It’s the biggest hotel chain you’ve never heard of.

But with 1.2 million rooms in 80 countries, Indian technology start-up OYO Rooms already claims to be the world’s second biggest hotel operator trailing only Marriott International.

Valued at more than $10bn and flush with cash from the Softbank Vision Fund, as well as other investors including Airbnb and Silicon Valley venture capital funds Sequoia Capital and Lightspeed Venture Partners, the growth of OYO Rooms has been remarkable.

Starting with just one hotel in 2013 in Gurgaon, a satellite city of Delhi, the company now operates more than 23,000 hotels worldwide including 85 in Britain.

Wander the streets of Blackpool, Brighton or London’s...
description: It’s the biggest hotel chain you’ve never heard of.
